intro: Eriospermum platyphyllum, commonly known as the broad-leaved eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eriospermum platyphyllum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
